content.text:
# 1861 Hunter colonial by-election

A by-election was held for the New South Wales Legislative Assembly electorate of The Hunter on 5 August 1861 because Isidore Blake resigned to accept appointment as a judge of the District Court.
Dates
{| class="wikitable"
! Date !! Event
|-
| 9 July 1861
| Isidore Blake resigned.
|-
| 13 July 1861
| Writ of election issued by the Speaker of the Legislative Assembly.
|-
| 31 July 1861
| Nominations at West Maitland.
|-
| 5 August 1861
| Polling day between 9 am and 4 pm.
|-
| 15 August 1861
| Return of writ
|}
Polling places
Result
}}
Isidore Blake resigned.
